Node.definition: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
literally: falsehood; hence: = state in which things that are being communicated are factually untrue
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
= the state in which something false is described or spoken about as true, so that others believe it to be truth

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

literally: to add (an activity to someone else's activities); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities add additional activities to those that other humans or deities are currently engaged in
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
= the state in which something false is described or spoken about as true, so that others believe it to be truth

= pointed missile, shot from a bow; slender and straight in shape and moving swiftly; ◄ made out of wood and/or iron; ► mainly used for hunting, in warfare, and occasionally for divination; ≈ symbol of aggression, affliction, and punishment
= a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

= a tough desert shrub, up to 2 m tall, with many small branches, few leaves, and clusters of white flowers; ◄ Retama raetam; ► provides some shade in the desert, and its roots contain oil and so make a very hot fire
exclamation expressing grief and dismay

Node.gloss: to sojourn|to live as alien|to dwell
Node.definition: = state in which humans live in a place which is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time
= nation, usually identified with Greece; considered the descendants of Japheth (יֶפֶת) through his son Javan
= people living in a certain home or larger area, usually with a common ancestor
= ethnic group consisting of Arab (עַרְבִי) nomads or Bedouin, known as warriors and sheep herders; ◄ descendants of Kedar
= state in which a certain event has progressed long enough for it to be able to stop

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country
